actor_awards.notes: She received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actress for 'The Dark Angel' (1935). Born in India, she spent much of her career concealing her mixed-race heritage to avoid prejudice in Hollywood.

filmography.title: Wuthering Heights
filmography.role_description: The headstrong and passionate woman torn between her love for the brooding Heathcliff and the refined Edgar Linton.
filmography.plot: A foundling adopted by a wealthy family on the Yorkshire Moors grows up to fall in love with his foster sister, with tragic consequences.
filmography.awards: New York Film Critics Circle: Win – Best Film

filmography.title: The Dark Angel
filmography.role_description: A woman caught in a romantic triangle during World War I, believing her true love has been killed in action.
filmography.plot: A woman mourns her fiancé who is believed dead in WWI, not knowing he is alive but blind and hiding from her to not be a burden.

filmography.title: The Scarlet Pimpernel
filmography.role_description: The French actress wife of Sir Percy Blakeney, who is unaware that her fop of a husband is actually a daring hero.
filmography.plot: An English aristocrat leads a double life, rescuing French aristocrats from the guillotine while posing as a foppish dandy in society.

filmography.title: The Private Life of Henry VIII
filmography.role_description: The ill-fated second wife of King Henry VIII, whose execution sets the tone for the King's future marriages.
filmography.plot: King Henry VIII moves through several wives in his quest for an heir, starting with the execution of Anne Boleyn.

filmography.title: These Three
filmography.role_description: A schoolteacher whose life and career are ruined by a malicious lie spread by a student.
filmography.plot: Two schoolteachers are accused of an illicit relationship by a lying student, destroying their lives and the school.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Bonita Granville)

filmography.title: The Lodger
filmography.role_description: A singer and dancer in turn-of-the-century London who becomes the fixation of a mysterious boarder suspected of being Jack the Ripper.
filmography.plot: A landlady suspects her new lodger is Jack the Ripper, fearing for the safety of her beautiful niece.

filmography.title: A Song to Remember
filmography.role_description: The famous French writer who becomes the controlling lover and patron of composer Frédéric Chopin.
filmography.plot: The life of Polish composer Frédéric Chopin and his relationship with the writer George Sand.

filmography.title: Berlin Express
filmography.role_description: A mysterious French secretary traveling on a train through post-war Germany, caught in an assassination plot.
filmography.plot: A group of train passengers from different nations become embroiled in a mystery to locate a kidnapped German peace activist.

filmography.title: That Uncertain Feeling
filmography.role_description: A bored society wife who develops psychosomatic hiccups and seeks excitement with an eccentric pianist.
filmography.plot: A happily married woman sees a psychoanalyst for her hiccups and is advised to look for romance outside her marriage.

filmography.title: The Divorce of Lady X
filmography.role_description: A debutante who poses as a scandalous divorcée after being forced to spend the night in a lawyer's hotel suite.
filmography.plot: A woman is forced to stay in a stranger's hotel room due to fog, leading to a series of misunderstandings when he assumes she is a client.

filmography.title: Hangover Square
filmography.role_description: A manipulative dance hall singer who exploits a mentally unstable composer, leading to her demise.
filmography.plot: A composer with a split personality commits murders during blackouts, driven by the sound of discordant noises.

filmography.title: The Cowboy and the Lady
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a presidential hopeful who poses as a maid and falls for a rodeo cowboy.
filmography.plot: A wealthy socialite masquerades as a servant and marries a cowboy, keeping her true identity a secret.

filmography.title: Dark Waters
filmography.role_description: A traumatized survivor of a shipwreck who begins to fear for her sanity while staying at a swampy plantation.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman recovering from a shipwreck goes to stay with her aunt and uncle on a plantation, but strange events make her fear for her life.

filmography.title: Lydia
filmography.role_description: An elderly woman who reunites with four former loves and reminisces about her romantic past.
filmography.plot: An old woman invites four of her past suitors to tea to recall their romances and discover which one she truly loved.

filmography.title: 'Til We Meet Again
filmography.role_description: A terminally ill woman who shares a romance with a criminal facing execution on a trans-Pacific voyage.
filmography.plot: Two doomed people, a dying woman and a man on his way to the gallows, fall in love on an ocean liner.

filmography.title: Beloved Enemy
filmography.role_description: An English aristocrat who falls in love with an Irish rebel leader during the Irish War of Independence.
filmography.plot: During the Irish rebellion, an English woman falls for an Irish leader, complicating the peace negotiations.

filmography.title: Affectionately Yours
filmography.role_description: The ex-wife of a reporter who is pursued by him again while he tries to cover a story.
filmography.plot: A foreign correspondent tries to win back his ex-wife before she marries another man, using a series of tricks.

filmography.title: Forever and a Day
filmography.role_description: A hotel receptionist in this multi-generational anthology film about a London house.
filmography.plot: The story of a London house and its inhabitants from 1804 to the London Blitz of World War II.

filmography.title: The Lion Has Wings
filmography.role_description: The wife of a Royal Air Force officer in this wartime propaganda film.
filmography.plot: A documentary-style drama showcasing the capabilities of the Royal Air Force at the start of World War II.

filmography.title: Folies Bergère de Paris
filmography.role_description: The wife of a wealthy baron who is impersonated by an entertainer.
filmography.plot: An entertainer impersonates a look-alike financier to help solve the baron's financial and romantic problems.

filmography.title: Over the Moon
filmography.role_description: A poor country girl who inherits a fortune and travels Europe, testing her fiancé's love.
filmography.plot: A woman inherits a fortune and goes on a spending spree, alienating the doctor who loves her.

filmography.title: First Comes Courage
filmography.role_description: A Norwegian woman who appears to collaborate with the Nazis but is actually a spy for the resistance.
filmography.plot: A woman in Nazi-occupied Norway is despised by her neighbors for associating with a German officer, but she is actually a spy.

filmography.title: Temptation
filmography.role_description: A woman who schemes to murder her archaeologist husband with the help of her lover.
filmography.plot: A woman marries a wealthy archaeologist but plans to kill him with poison to be with her lover.

filmography.title: Désirée
filmography.role_description: The first wife of Napoleon Bonaparte who faces the heartbreak of divorce for political reasons.
filmography.plot: The story of Désirée Clary, who was engaged to Napoleon Bonaparte but eventually became the Queen of Sweden.

filmography.title: Hotel
filmography.role_description: A wealthy British aristocrat involved in a hit-and-run accident cover-up.
filmography.plot: The owner of a New Orleans hotel struggles to keep it afloat while dealing with various guests and a corporate takeover attempt.

filmography.title: Interval
filmography.role_description: An aging woman who travels to Mexico and finds romance with a much younger man. Oberon also produced this film.
filmography.plot: A woman trying to escape her past finds love with a younger man while traveling in Mexico.
